{{also|哀莫大于心死}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=哀莫大于心死|type=11211|lit=Nothing is more lamentable than a dead heart.}}

===Etymology===
From ''{{w|Zhuangzi (book)|Zhuangzi}}'', chapter 21 (Tian Zifang):
{{zh-x|夫 '''哀.莫.大於.心.死'''，而 人 死 亦 次 之。|There is no sorrow to be compared with the death of the mind. The death of the body is of but secondary importance.}}

===Pronunciation===

|m=āi mò dàyú xīn sǐ
|c=oi1 mok6 daai6 jyu1 sam1 sei2
|cat=prov
}}

===Proverb===
{{zh-proverb}}

# Despair is the greatest sorrow; Nothing gives greater cause for sorrow than despair; There is no grief so great as despair; There is no poverty like the poverty of spirit.

[[zh:哀莫大於心死]]
